question: Question_06
statement:
\textbf{Multiple Choice}

$\displaystyle 10^{200,000,000,000}$ days from today it will be

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  (a) Sunday
\item
  (b) Monday
\item
  (c) Tuesday
\item
  (d) Wednesday
\item
  (e) None of the above.
\end{itemize}

\emph{Assume that the original exam was written on a Monday.}
sols:
The answer is \textbf{d = Wednesday}

Proceeding as in the hints, we need to compute

$\displaystyle 10^{200000000000} \equiv 3^{200000000000} \mod{7}$

We use Euler's formula which states that

$3^{\phi(7)} = 3^{6} \equiv 1 \mod{7}$

Next, notice that $\displaystyle 200000000000$ is not divisible by 6
(the sum of the digits is not divisible by 3 so the number is not
divisible by 3). However $\displaystyle 200000000004$ is divisible by 6
and thus, $\displaystyle 200000000004-6 = 199999999998 = 6s$ is
divisible by 6 (here we let \emph{s} be an integer). Hence

\begin{align*}
10^{200000000000} &\equiv 3^{200000000000}  \mod{7}\\
&\equiv 3^{2}\cdot 3^{199999999998}  \mod{7}\\
&\equiv 2\cdot (3^{6})^{s}  \mod{7}\\
&\equiv 2  \mod{7}\end{align*}

and thus, two days from Monday is a Wednesday.
hints:
Note that 7 days from now, we are at the same day we were at today. So
it suffices to compute this number modulo 7 then count that many days
from today (Monday).
Euler's Formula will help a lot.
